text:
<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Domain Validation Error Rates>
We are investigating increased error rates in domain validations. Customers are experiencing an error when attempting to approve certificate issuance on the validation website using email validation. Certificates requested using DNS validation are being delayed.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Domain Validation Error Rates>
We can confirm customers are experiencing an error when attempting to validate a domain using email validation for certificate requests and renewals. This is preventing issuance of these certificates. Operations using existing certificates, including binding and unbinding certificates, are not impacted. Certificates requested using DNS validation are being delayed.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Domain Validation Error Rates>
Between 7:56 AM and 11:26 AM PST customers were experiencing errors when attempting to validate a domain. Operations with existing certificates were not impacted. Binding and unbinding of certificates with AWS services were not impacted. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Error Rates and Latencies>
We are investigating increased error rates latencies for stack creation, deletion, and updates in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Delays in Launching and Terminating Clusters>
We are investigating delays in launching and terminating clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Error Rates and Latencies>
We can confirm increased error rates and latencies for creating and deleting stacks in the US-EAST-1 Region and continue to work towards resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Delays in Launching and Terminating Clusters>
We can confirm delays in launching and terminating clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region and continue to work towards resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Error Rates and Latencies>
New stack operations are progressing successfully and we are in the process of unblocking pending update and delete operations for existing stacks in the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Delays in Launching and Terminating Clusters>
We can confirm delays in launching and terminating clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. Submission of jobs to existing clusters is not impacted. We continue to work towards resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Error Rates and Latencies>
We continue to unblock the remaining stacks that are pending their update or delete operations in the US-EAST-1 Region. CloudFormation operations for new stacks are working normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Error Rates and Latencies>
Between 12:35 PM and 6:20 PM PST we experienced increased latencies for stack creation, deletion, and updates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Delays in Launching and Terminating Clusters>
Between 12:40 PM and 6:30 PM PST we experienced delays in starting and terminating clusters in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
